title: Scott Tucker Scott Spring Classic
description: Gentlemen's event that will challenge your best bike handling skills and endurance
course: This course will encompass paved highways, local roads a fair amount of gravel grinding.
notes: This is not for the weak hearted and requires a team effort to complete.

title: Two Rivers Time Trial Training Series
Cane Creek Timberland
description: The Cane Creek Timberland is Arkansas’s newest mountain bike race, and this is its first year on the Arkansas Mountain Bike Championship Series. The park has over 18 miles of trails open to mountain bikes. The trail system features flowy downhills, short uphill climbs, and 52 bridges that make for a fast ride.
course: The course is 8 miles long on the park's trail system. It will be marked with pink arrows. The trails are permanently blazed with red, white, and yellow blazes.
registration: Registration will be ONSITE only, the day of the race.
notes: Payout Uses the Standard AMBCS pay out charts Available at www.AMBCS.com Pay out for CAT 1 Unified is 90% at 40% depth of field.
directions: From Little Rock: Head south on I-530 towards Pine Bluff. Take the last exit (Hwy 65/425) toward Lake Village/Monticello. Turn right outside Pine Bluff to follow Hwy 425. Head south into Star City. Go STRAIGHT through the light. Turn left onto Highway 293 (Cane Creek Rd.) Park is five miles east, on the left side of the road.

title: 2014 Syllamo's Revenge
description:
The 10th Annual Syllamo’s Revenge 
Ride.  
The Syllamo Mountain Bike Trail stretches over thousands of acres of the Ozark National Forest, and offers riders changing scenery and beautiful views of the White River and Sylamore Creek Valleys, and the Ozark Mountains.
course:
The Course will give riders 50 miles of dedicated single track, that has earned IMBA Epic status.

The route description is long and detailed, but by looking at the map while you read the route plan, you will be able to get the general idea of how the trail system will be ridden.   The course will be well marked, but this will help. 


The ride will start and finish at the Big Pavilion in Blanchard Springs Recreation Area.  Directions to Blanchard Springs, and the Syllamo Trail Map can be found on the website under the MAPS tab.   

Other than the road to and from the Pavilion to Blanchard Road, your tires will touch pavement only to cross Hwy 5 two times.  If you find yourself on a paved surface, you’re off the course.  In addition, if you find yourself riding on a road that is not explicitly mentioned in the route plan, and marked with white arrows, you’re off the course.  There are a few places that the loops use short sections of old log roads to connect, but carsonite posts, with colored blazes that match the loop color, point riders in the right direction.  All riders must make sure that the workers at Check Point 2 Record your number! 
All riders must make sure that the workers at Check Point 3 record your number! 
Make sure that the workers at the last Check Point 4 record your number too!
registration:
www.syllamosrevenge.com
Packet pickup: 
Will be Friday, May 16th on the East Side of the square in downtown Mtn View. 
Also from 6am to 7am on Saturday before the event. 
Pre Race Meeting at 7:15. Ride begins at 7:30am.
notes:
T-Shirts will be given to all participants.
All Checkpoints Will Have 
Water, HEED, Bananas, Oranges, and Fig Bars.

Approximate distance to checkpoints:

Start to CP 1	15 Miles
CP 1 to CP 2	11 Miles
CP 2 to CP 3	9 Miles
CP 3 to Finish	14 Miles
Cut Off Times: 
Checkpoint 2 @ Hwy 5 Trail Head Cut Off Time is 2:00 pm. 
Checkpoint 3 @ Bad Branch Trail Head Cut Off Time is 3:00 pm.  
*Cut off times may be adjusted to ensure rider safety.
directions:
Directions to Blanchard Springs Recreation Area (Ride Start) 

From Mountain View: West on Main Street from Court Square.  Turn Right on AR 87 North at City Hall. (2 blocks from the square)  AR 87 ends at AR 14.  Turn left on 14, then right at Blanchard Springs Recreation Area. 

From Little Rock: Take AR 67/167 North to AR 5 North.  (Exit at Cabot)  Follow AR 5 North all the way into Mountain View.  Be careful not miss Hwy 5’s left turn 2 miles past Drasco, AR.  At the first stoplight, turn right on AR 5,9, &14 and travel approximately 5 miles.  You will go down the mountain and turn Left on AR 14 West toward Fifty Six, AR.  This turn will be opposite Angler’s Restaurant.  Blanchard Springs will be approximately 6 miles on your right.

From Springfield/Harrison: Take Hwy 65 S to Marshall, AR.  Turn left on AR 14 East.  You’ll pass through Harriet, Big Flat, and Fifty Six, AR.  Blanchard Springs will be on your left as you leave the town of Fifty Six. 

From Memphis: Take I-55 North to AR 64 West to Bald Knob.  Take AR 67 North toward Batesville.  Turn Left, at stoplight, on AR 14 West and follow into Mountain View.  Turn right at the first stoplight on AR 5,9, &14.  Go down the mountain and turn left on AR 14 West.  This turn will be opposite Anglers Restaurant.  Blanchard Springs will be approximately 6 miles on your right.

From St Louis: Take I-44 S to Rolla.  Take MO 63 South to West Plains.  Turn right on MO 160 West to a spot in the road called South Fork. (Approximately 6 miles south of West Plains)  Turn left on Hwy E, which turns into AR 223 South.  Follow AR 223 South through Viola, AR into Calico Rock.  Turn Right on AR 56 West.  Go though Calico Rock to the stop sign.  Turn Left on AR 5 South and cross the White River.  Turn right on AR 14 West. (Approximately 16 miles)  Blanchard Springs will be approximately 6 miles on your right. 

From Fort Smith/Conway: Take I-40 East to Morrilton.  Exit on AR 9 North to Choctaw.  Stay on AR 9/AR 65 through Clinton.  AR 9 will turn right just out of Clinton, and continue to Mountain View, (road is very curvy, so be careful), ending downtown at the square.  Follow directions above from Mountain View.

From Blanchard Springs: turn to Big Pavilion: Blanchard Springs entrance will just east of Fifty Six on Hwy 14.  Go 3 miles down the mountain, and stay left on the main road.  The Big Pavilion will be on your left in a large open area.  The Red Bull Tent will be next to the Pavilion; you won’t be able to miss it.

title: Battle for Townsend Ridge
course: 9 miles of non technical single track

title: True Grit Ride 100
description: A ride to benefit the Community Services Clearinghouse. 10, 35, 50, 75, and 100 mile routes are designated.
course: The courses all begin and end at Ben Geren Park with stops in Greenwood, Charleston and other cities.
notes: There will be well-stocked pit stops throughout the course, and a cookout at the end.
directions: Ben Geren Park is located on South Zero Street in Fort Smith, due south of the airport.

title: Arkansas State Road Race p/b Healthsouth
The Eurekan Tour Rides
notes:
*Master Men - All riders are competing for the overall purse. 50+ racers are eligible for the 40+ purse. 50+ purse is bonus money. Ex. if a 50+ rider finishes first overall, then they receive both the overall first place cash, plus first place 50+ bonus money
Payouts will occur immediately following finalized results.

title: Slaughter Pen Jam Mt. Bike Festival
Arkansas State Crit at Memorial Park
De Pijp Smoke and suds weekend
course: a mix of fast grass and single track
registration: standard entry fees. registration opens on race day
notes: fun. with kids race prior to the OPEN race

title: NW Arkansas Microcross
course: This is an ever changing and challenging course designed to get cyclocross riders ready for their big day.  Course has full barries, mud pits, sand pits and fly overs as well as run ups and much more all in just over or under .5 miles.
notes: Racing starts at 6:00 PM sharp until time change and then at 5:30.  Instruction and practice laps are one 1/2 hour before race time.
directions: Located behind Good Bikes, NW Arkansas Microcross is located off exit 62 from Highway 49, South towards Farmington in Fayetteville, AR.  Right across the street from Lowes.

title: Yell County CX Classic
description: Yell County CX Classic Presented by Carr's Chain Reaction
course: The course will be on the banks of the Arkansas River at Veterans Memorial Park in Dardanelle. This course is 1.2 miles of asphalt, gravel, grass, mud, sand, and 2 barrier sections.
registration: You can register online or on location the day of.
notes:
$400 pay out
Mens Cat 1/2/3/4 Race Pays 5 Positions
Womens Cat 1/2/3 Race Pays 3 Positions
directions:
From Little Rock take the Pottsville exit and head south towards Dardanelle, Take a left onto Highway 7 and cross the Arkansas River Bridge, Take first left after bridge onto Front Street, Veterans park is on your left.

From Fort Smith, Take the Arkansas Tech/HWY 7 exit, Take a right onto HWY 7 and continue south into Dardanelle, After you cross the Arkansas River Bridge take first left onto Front Street. Veteran park will be on your left

address.street: Western Hills Park, 5207 Western Hills Ave
